Comments_List: Very little. It was mostly review from undergraduate. I guess I learned pericyclic reactions and how to draw 3D molecules better...
A better understanding of physical organic chemistry

I especially learned how physical principles relate to organic chemistry. I have a much better understanding of strained molecules, molecular interactions, and underlying physical explanations with regard to organic chemistry.
I learnt a lot about pericyclic reactions.
mostly physical organic chemistry
Learned how to take notes in a graduate level course, how to apply ideas to deeper questions, and wide applications for physical organic knowledge.
More of an orbital view of reactions.
New skills in organic chemistry

It seemed very disorganized, and seemingly unimportant concepts (like host-guest chemistry) were drawn out over like 3 class periods while more fundamentally important concepts (pericyclic reactions and Linear Free Energy relationships) were given very little time at all. The theme of the course seemed to be more based on conveying history than actually conveying what was practical and/or important.
We spent too much time talking about some topics, but glossed over other more important things.
I appreciated that Prof. Jorgensen assigned problem sets. I wish Prof. Jorgensen made lectures more engaging.

strengths: jorgensen is very familiar with his field
weaknesses: we only barely scratched the surface; a lot more could be on the syllabus
Strengths: Problem sets and fantastic lecture stories
Good problem sets.   Clear examples in class of test like problems.
Course material was interesting, though felt a bit disjointed.
No-I took it because it was a necessary option for graduate students, but was very disappointed with the results.
I would recommend this course to a student interested in understanding why organic reaction mechanisms occur in the ways they do.
If you are an organic chemistry student, I think it is necessary to have this information at some point in your career.
Yes. I learned a lot of new information that can be applied to many branches of chemistry.
Yes.  Essential for anyone interested in organic chemistry.
Yes, I enjoyed the course.
